data.name: The name of the custom method cannot be empty.
data.value: The name of the custom method cannot be empty.

data.name: The method needs to have at least one pass defined.
data.value: The method needs to have at least one pass defined.

data.name: The pass constant cannot be displayed as text because it contains invalid characters.
data.value: The pass constant cannot be displayed as text because it contains invalid characters.

data.name: The pass constant must not be empty.
data.value: The pass constant must not be empty.

data.value: The custom erasure method can only comprise passes containing constant or random passes

data.value: The program does not have the required permissions to erase the disk.

data.value: The file {0} is a hard link or a symbolic link thus the contents of the file was not erased.

data.value: The file {0} was not erased because it was deleted before it could be erased.

data.value: The file {0} was not erased because the containing directory was deleted before it could be erased.

data.value: Could not force closure of file \"{0}\" {1}(locked by {0})

data.name: The folder {0} was not erased because the containing directory was deleted before it could be erased.
data.value: The folder {0} was not erased because the containing directory was deleted before it could be erased.

data.name: The folder {0} could not be deleted because the folder's permissions prevents the deletion of the folder.
data.value: The folder {0} could not be deleted because the folder's permissions prevents the deletion of the folder.

data.name:
dir Erases files and folders in the directory
 arguments: dir=<directory>[,-excludeMask][,+includeMask][,deleteIfEmpty[=true|false]]
 excludeMask A wildcard expression for files and folders to
 exclude.
 includeMask A wildcard expression for files and folders to
 include.
 The include mask is applied before the exclude mask.
 deleteIfEmpty Deletes the folder at the end of the erasure if it is
 empty. If this parameter is not specified, it defaults
 to true.
data.value:
dir Erases files and folders in the directory
 arguments: dir=<directory>[,-excludeMask][,+includeMask][,deleteIfEmpty=[true|false]]
 excludeMask A wildcard expression for files and folders to
 exclude.
 includeMask A wildcard expression for files and folders to
 include.
 The include mask is applied before the exclude mask.
 deleteIfEmpty Deletes the folder at the end of the erasure if it is
 empty. If this parameter is not specified, it defaults
 to true.

data.name: The path you selected is invalid.
data.value: The path you selected is invalid.

data.name: recyclebin Erases files and folders in the recycle bin
data.value: recyclebin Erases files and folders in the recycle bin

data.name: The destination directory cannot be within the source directory.
data.value: The destination directory cannot be within the source directory.

data.name: Old resident file system table files
data.value: Old resident file system table files

data.name:
unused Erases unused space in the volume.
 arguments: unused=<drive>[,clusterTips[=(true|false)]]
 clusterTips If specified, the drive's files will have their
 cluster tips erased. This parameter accepts a Boolean
 value (true/false) as an argument; if none is specified
 true is assumed.
data.value:
unused Erases unused space in the volume.
 arguments: unused=<drive>[,clusterTips[=(true|false)]]
 clusterTips If specified, the drive's files will have their
 cluster tips erased. This parameter accepts a Boolean
 value (true/false) as an argument; if none is specified
 true is assumed.
